body:
This appears to have been caused by an acd.Node without an Id...

What sequence of operations lead to this - can you provide a sequence which I can use to reproduce?

I've seen this while moving/renaming files with both nautilus and filebot. I don't have any concrete step-by step guide to reproduce this issue since it only happens once in a while. It does look like it only happens when I do a lot of files at once. And maybe this error pops up on 1/20 maybe. If I try again it works. Is there any logging/actions you want me to do/send you which would give you more information?

I've figured this one out - it should be fixed in this beta

http://beta.rclone.org/v1.35-26-gaa62e93/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

issue.title: [ACD + FUSE] panic

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.34-DEV

On master (cb9f1eefd24e9a4d15cdee4e27396b4d773a00a9).

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

macOS Sierra 10.12.1 (16B2555)

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Amazon Cloud Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone mount acd: /Volumes/Local`

Then messing-up with `bup` on /Volumes/Local

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Not too sure if this is a fuse or rclone issue.

issue.title: Bug: Fast renames of different files in the same directory on ACD cause a non-fatal panic

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
v1.35-DEV

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux x86-64

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
ACD

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
bash loop doing mv in a directory to rename many files

This ends up on stdoud:

issue.title: fuse: panic in handler for Rename - assignment to entry in nil map

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi Good, 

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
rclone v1.36-DEV

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux Debian 9.0 (64 bit)

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive

Same problem as for ACD : 

- fuse: panic in handler for Rename #973
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/973

And 

- Rename Panic #1226
https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/1226

But i'm using GSuite (Google), and the last version in developpment for the test(s)

Please let me know.. 

Regards,
